greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of binary rooted trees with n leaves of exactly k colors and all non-leaf nodes having out-degree 2.
comment: See table 2.2 in the Johnson reference.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
V. P. Johnson, Enumeration Results on Leaf Labeled Trees, Ph. D. Dissertation, Univ. Southern Calif., 2012.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n<2, k*n, `if`(n::odd, 0,
T:= (n, k)-> add((-1)^i*binomial(k, i)*A(n, k-i), i=0..k):
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 23 2018
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^i Binomial[k, i] A[n, k - i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 02 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: (PARI) \\ here R(n,k) is k-th column of A319539 as a vector.
R(n,k)={my(v=vector(n)); v[1]=k; for(n=2, n, v[n]=sum(j=1, (n-1)\2, v[j]*v[n-j]) + if(n%2, 0, binomial(v[n/2]+1, 2))); v}
M(n)={my(v=vector(n, k, R(n,k)~)); Mat(vector(n, k, sum(i=1, k, (-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k,i)*v[i])))}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 22 2018
